result.title: A useful and useless thing I guess...
result.content:
Whenever there's a contest, they don't ever link the original blog post to the contest! It's really irritating.

Because of that, I've written a program so that it's output is the link to the original post for whichever contest number you type in.

Yes, I tested the program for all 422 contests. It was fun.

Anyway, here is the code. I used Python 3.

Example:

Input:

240

Output:

Codeforces Round #240 by matrix:

http://codeforces.com/blog/entry/11458

There are a few exceptions, like contests from 229 to 233. In which case the output says that the post has been deleted. And then there are contests which don't let you see the blog post. Those contests are 348, 351, 411, 413, 414, and 416. That makes 11 missing contests.

If you can find the original posts then please leave them in the comments!

Edit: Tiny fix so that you can find contests 423 and 424.
